bib_record.title: - The neutron capture and fission cross section of  Am-241 in the energy range from 10 to 250 keV -.

free_txt: Karlsruhe 3 MV pulsed Van de Graaff
in diam, 30 mm thick, with a pulse shape
discrimination equipment, see 'a simple pulse shape
with a 25 mm thick graphite converter used for
registration of gamma-rays from capture and fission
.both detectors were shielded with lead and were
located at backward angles of 120 deg with respect
to the beam axis.They were completely outside the
Total systematical error, details given in
Karlsruhe 3 MV pulsed Van de Graaff
moderate energy resolution at short flight paths.
.The flight path was 50 to 66.4 mm long.
.A set of four samples were mounted on a sample changer
and cycled automatically into the measuring position.
The cycle time was determined by integrating the beam
.A dummy sample was used to correct for background
events and a U-235 sample served for normalization
of the fission correction and as a fission standard.
.The capture cross-section ratios of Am versus Au-197
have been measured in four runs of different flight
on method and  apparatus are given.
.A sintered pellet of 3.6 grams of AmO2, 17.7 mm in
diameter and 2.2 mm in thickness, has been prepared,
which was welded in a 0.15 mm thick stainless steel
.Part of the measurement were made with a similar
Am-241 sample with double the diameter and 1/3 of
.Different Au-197 and U-235 metal samples plus some
graphite and stainless steel samples were used for
given in private communication of F.Kaeppeler.
